result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Madison S Knapp

records.addlTxt:
10:38 AM Defendant Madison S Knapp in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Madison S Knapp. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests another date in 30 days, to receive an offer from the State. Defense has discovery. 
State will forward pre-trial offer to defense. 
Court sets another hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant failed to sign signature bond as ordered by the Court. Upon signing of the $  signature bond, warrant may be quashed and defendant released.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to contact the Clerk of Courts office to sign the signature bond within 5 business days, if not a warrant will be issued.

09:44 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Madison S Knapp appeared by zoom video means.  Victim A appearing in the gallery.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for August 4, 2022.
